intro: Draba laegaardii, commonly known as the Laegaard's rockcress, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent odor. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and high altitudes. Draba laegaardii has a compact growth habit with basal leaves and produces flowers in early spring. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity in its native habitat.
